item.title: üéß Why I replaced Spotify with a Playstation Portable for a month
item.description: If you’re familiar with my previous essay, you know I have mixed feelings on music streaming. Spotify, with its algorithmic recommendations and “gamification” of listening hours, seems purpose-built for constant, mindless music consumption. I was sick of it. Would I enjoy music more if I wasn’t in the Spotify ecosystem at all? This October, I set out to answer this question - the hard way. I blocked Spotify for the whole month and moved my music over to… A Playstation Portable!

item.title: üçÖ‚è∞ Using the Pomodoro Technique to make a Pomodoro Timer (Part 1)
item.description: first prototype! Using the Pomodoro Technique to make a Pomodoro Timer (Part 1) A famous Henry Ford quote goes: “Nothing is particularly hard, if you divide it into small [enough] jobs”. One popular way to practically implement this advice is something called the “Pomodoro Technique”. 1 The Pomodoro Technique aims to divide the day into bite-sized, productive time chunks. The idea is to set some kind of timer for 25 minutes before you start working.
